grid

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • grid.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    This class describes a grid object. It contains squares on coordinates that range from (0,0) (upper leftmost square) to (getHSize()-1, getVSize()-1) (lower rightmost square).
    Author:
    Dieter Castel, Jonas Devlieghere, Vincent Reniers and Stefan Pante

      • isValidHSize

        public boolean isValidHSize(int size)
        Returns whether the given size is a valid horizontal size.
        Parameters:
        size - The size to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given size is bigger than the minimum horizontal size. False otherwise | size >= Grid.MIN_HSIZE

      • isValidVSize

        public boolean isValidVSize(int size)
        Returns whether the given size is a valid vertical size.
        Parameters:
        size - The size to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given size is bigger than the minimum vertical size. False otherwise. | size >= Grid.MIN_VSIZE

      • isValidCoordinate

        public boolean isValidCoordinate(Coordinate coordinate)
        Checks whether the given coordinate is a valid coordinate for all the grids.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - The coordinate to check.
        Returns:
        True if the x and y coordinate are not lower than zero. False otherwise. | coordinate.getX() >= 0 | && | coordinate.getY() >= 0

      • getNeighbor

        public Square getNeighbor(Square square,
                 Direction direction)
                   throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Returns the neighbor of the given square.
        Parameters:
        square - The square from which the neighbor will be returned.
        direction - The direction in which the neighbor will be calculated.
        Returns:
        The neighbor of the given square in the given direction.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If there is no square at the neighboring coordinate.

      • getNeighborDirection

        public Direction getNeighborDirection(Square square,
                             Square neighbor)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Given a square and its neighbors, we return the direction the neighbor is in.
        Parameters:
        square - The square which has the neighboring square.
        neighbor - The neighbor square you want the direction it is facing from the square.
        Returns:
        The direction the neighbor is in from the square.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given squares are no neighbors.

      • getSquare

@Raw
public Square getSquare(Coordinate coordinate)
                 throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Returns the square at the given coordinate.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - The coordinate of the square.
        Returns:
        The square at the given coordinate.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If there is no such coordinate in the given grid.

      • getSquares

        public java.util.ArrayList<Square> getSquares(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> coordinates)
        Returns a list with the squares at the given coordinates. Only the valid coordinates of the grid that return a square are added to the resulting list. Non valid coordinates are ignored. There is no guarantee about the order of the squares.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The list of coordinates of which you want the squares.
        Returns:
        A list of squares corresponding to all the valid given coordinates. Not in a specific order.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The coordinate of the given square.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the given square is not placed in this grid. | !contains(square)

      • hasNeighbor

        public boolean hasNeighbor(Square fromSquare,
                  Direction via,
                  Square toSquare)
        Checks if the given squares are neighbors in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        fromSquare - The square which will be the starting reference point.
        via - The direction in which the square should be a neighbor.
        toSquare - The square that should be the neighbor in the given direction of fromSquare.
        Returns:
        true if the square is the neighbor in the given direction otherwise false

        Returns an HashMap with the neighbors of the given square by direction.
        Returns:
        An HashMap with neighbors with there direction as the key and the Square as value.

                         java.util.NoSuchElementException

        Parameters:
        destination - The destination Teleport to find.
        Returns:
        The square having the given destination as a Teleport.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given destination is null or the square of the destination is obstructed.
